Table of Contents

Class WorldRunner

Namespace
Nebula
Assembly
Nebula.dll

Manages the network state of all NetNodes in the scene. Inside the NetRunner are one or more “Worlds”. Each World represents some part of the game that is isolated from other parts. For example, different maps, dungeon instances, etc. Worlds are dynamically created by calling CreateWorld(UUID, PackedScene).

Worlds cannot directly interact with each other and do not share state.

Players only exist in one World at a time, so it can be helpful to think of the clients as being connected to a World directly.

[ScriptPath("res://addons/Nebula/Core/WorldRunner.cs")]
public class WorldRunner : Node, IDisposable

Constructors

WorldRunner() 

public WorldRunner()

Fields

AutoPlayerCleanup

When a player disconnects, we automatically dispose of their data in the World. If you wish to manually handle this, (e.g. you wish to save their data first), then set this to false, and call CleanupPlayer(ENetPacketPeer) when you are ready to dispose of their data yourself. CleanupPlayer(ENetPacketPeer) is all that is needed to fully dispose of their data on the server, including freeing their owned nodes (when DespawnOnUnowned is true).

public bool AutoPlayerCleanup

Field Value

bool

ClientAvailableNodes 

public long ClientAvailableNodes

Field Value

long

RootScene

Only used by the client to determine the current root scene.

public NetNodeWrapper RootScene

CurrentTick

The current network tick. On the client side, this does not represent the server's current tick, which will always be slightly ahead.

CheckStaticInitialization(NetNodeWrapper)

This is called for nodes that are initialized in a scene by default. Clients automatically dequeue all network nodes on initialization. All network nodes on the client side must come from the server by gaining Interest in the node.

public bool CheckStaticInitialization(NetNodeWrapper wrapper)

Parameters

wrapper NetNodeWrapper

Returns

bool

CleanupPlayer(ENetPacketPeer)

Immediately disconnects the player from the world and frees all of their data from the server, including freeing their owned nodes (when DespawnOnUnowned is true).

public void CleanupPlayer(ENetPacketPeer peer)
